intro: Tibouchina hospita var. albiflora, commonly known as white-flowered tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The flowers are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to gardens.
